creator: AnahíG6
title: The Cold Shoulder
materials_required: USB micro to USB data transfer cable
Liquid soap in the colors of your preference
Acrylic sheet 600 mm x 600 mm x 2mm
description: This project describes how to create an inflatable necklace that inflates and lights up when the person wearing it speaks. It uses PVC cushions, a vacuum pump, an LED strip, a sound sensor, and a microcontroller, all housed in a control box on the back of the necklace. The aim is to create a wearable using readily available materials, with templates and code provided.
steps: Find all the required materials and tools.
Print the provided templates for the PVC cushions on wax paper.
Weld the PVC layers together using an iron or heat gun, placing the inner pieces between the PVC layers and using wax paper to prevent adhesion in unwanted areas.
Cut the PVC following the outline of the template and remove the wax paper carefully.
Fill two of the cushions with a thick liquid like shampoo and seal them with PVC glue.
Place a tube on the opening of the third cushion (the inflatable one) and seal it with PVC glue.
Glue ribbon on the edge of the cushions to hide the openings and attach pressure buttons.
Upload the provided Arduino code to the Arduino Nano.
Wire up the Arduino Nano to the breadboard, including the LED strip, vacuum pump, and sound sensor, using transistors and resistors as described.
Measure and cut the LED strip to fit the interior line of the necklace, cover it with fabric, and glue it between layers 1 and 2.
Wire the LED strip and place the sound sensor in the middle of the necklace.
Cut the tube on the inflatable cushion and create a bundle with the wires from the LED strip and sound sensor, covering it with fabric.
Laser cut the control box from 2mm acrylic according to the provided template.
Cover the lid of the control box with colored material.
Fix the microcontroller, pump, and batteries inside the control box using double-sided tape.
Hang the control box from the back of the necklace.
